comments:
The scenario:

Developing a plugin that fires up an Editor (subclass of MultiPageEditorPart) using:

IViewSite.getPage().openEditor(input, <editorName>, true);

where input is my own implementation of IEditorInput.

In the init(IEditorSite site, IEditorInput input) method, I do the following:

   setSite(site);
   setInput(input);
   setTitle(input.getName());

input.getName() is not null.

If the editor is open and is dirty, when I shutdown Eclipse, it throws this NPE
and brings up an "empty" Save Resources dialog where there is a checkbox, but no
text to identify the editor.

Eclipse continues to run, but the "Error - An error has occurred" message box is
rather distressing.

The stack trace is included below:

Looks like part.getTitleToolTip() is returning NULL?
yes, overriding getTitleToolTip() in my editor seems to resolve the issue.
Added test for null tool tip and title.
identifying bug also provides workaround in Platform 2.1.x
